definition: to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly

sentences.english: They saw the mother robin flying about, and crying to her mate.
sentences.chinese: 他們還看見雌鳥到處飛，向她的伴侶哭訴。

sentences.english: Cry out to Him and ask Him to help mend your heart.
sentences.chinese: 向上帝哭訴和請求幫助修復你的心靈。

sentences.english: At last she keened her sorrow to me.
sentences.chinese: 終於她向我哭訴了悲痛之情。

sentences.english: The wife wept out her grief to her husband.
sentences.chinese: 妻子向丈夫哭訴自己的傷心事。

sentences.english: She's always snivelling about her unhappy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 她總是傷心哭訴自己童年不幸。

sentences.english: Listen carefully, their songs are the sniveling of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 仔細聽着，風中嗚咽的哭訴是他們的歌唱。

sentences.english: Melon da came running to ella, crying himself was the husband abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 瓜達跑來找埃利，哭訴本人被丈夫丟棄了。
她哭訴了她所受的苦難。

sentences.english: She wept out her grief to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她向母親哭訴着自己的傷心事。

sentences.english: Houyi i was told what was happening in the evening when he returned home from bumper hunting.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女們哭訴了白天發生的事。

sentences.english: Abu Bakr, the brother of the slain woman, wept through the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 死去婦女的兄弟，在葬禮現場哭訴。

sentences.english: The girl wept out her grief to her father.
sentences.chinese: 女孩對父親哭訴自己的傷心事。

sentences.english: Evening, Hou Yi got the home, the maidservants to complain tearfully the matter which the daytime occurred.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女們哭訴了白天發生的事。

sentences.english: Many lenders are squealing that more capital is not needed.
sentences.chinese: 許多銀行哭訴不需要更多的資本。

sentences.english: Having friends you know you can cry on or talk to about your deepest problems.
sentences.chinese: 擁有推心置腹的朋友可以哭訴自己最隱祕的問題。

sentences.english: Evening, Hou Yi returned home, the maid who had cried during the day what happened.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女們哭訴了白天發生的事。

definition: to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
